english_explanation: A is B (statement of fact). The particle は marks the topic of the sentence.
Question marker. Adding か to the end of a です sentence makes it a question.
The particle の connects nouns, showing possession or relationship (similar to English 's or 'of').
example_english: I am an employee of IMC.

english_explanation: The particle も means 'also' or 'too'. It replaces は, が, or を.
Negative form of です. 'is not' or 'are not'.
Demonstrative adjectives: この (this near me), その (that near you), あの (that over there).
Location demonstratives: ここ (here), そこ (there near you), あそこ (over there).
Where is ~? Used to ask about location.

pattern_structure: Time/Place から Time/Place まで
english_explanation: From ~ to/until ~. Used for time and place ranges.

pattern_regex: [きしちにみりいぎびぴ]ます
english_explanation: Polite present/future tense verb ending. Indicates an action that happens regularly or will happen.

pattern_regex: [きしちにみりいぎびぴ]ません
english_explanation: Polite negative present/future tense. 'do not' or 'will not'.

pattern_regex: [きしちにみりいぎびぴ]ました
english_explanation: Polite past tense. Indicates a completed action.

pattern_structure: Verb stem + ませんでした
pattern_regex: [きしちにみりいぎびぴ]ませんでした
english_explanation: Polite negative past tense. 'did not'.
example_japanese: 昨日は働きませんでした。

english_explanation: The particle に indicates destination with verbs of motion (go, come, return).
The particle で indicates means of transportation.
The particle と means 'and' for connecting nouns, or 'with' for doing things together.
The particle を marks the direct object of a transitive verb.
The particle で indicates the location where an action takes place.

pattern_regex: [きしちにみりいぎびぴ]ませんか
english_explanation: Polite invitation. 'Won't you ~?' or 'Shall we ~?'

pattern_regex: [きしちにみりいぎびぴ]ましょう
english_explanation: Polite volitional. 'Let's ~' (suggestion to do something together).

pattern_structure: Person に Thing を あげます
english_explanation: Give something to someone. に marks the recipient.
example_japanese: 友達にプレゼントをあげます。
example_english: I give a present to my friend.

pattern_structure: Person に Thing を もらいます
english_explanation: Receive something from someone. に marks the giver.
example_japanese: 友達にプレゼントをもらいます。
example_english: I receive a present from my friend.

pattern_regex: [あかさたなはまやらわがざだばぱ][いきしちにひみりぎじびぴ]です
english_explanation: i-adjective sentence ending. The い adjective directly modifies the noun.

pattern_structure: い-adjective stem + くないです
english_explanation: Negative form of i-adjectives. Remove い and add くないです.
example_japanese: この本は面白くないです。

pattern_structure: い-adjective stem + かったです
english_explanation: Past tense of i-adjectives. Remove い and add かったです.

pattern_structure: い-adjective stem + くなかったです
english_explanation: Negative past tense of i-adjectives.
example_japanese: 昨日は寒くなかったです。

pattern_regex: (静か|賑やか|有名|親切|元気|暇|便利|素敵|好き|嫌い|上手|下手)です
english_explanation: na-adjective sentence ending. Na-adjectives use な when modifying nouns.

pattern_structure: な-adjective + じゃありません
english_explanation: Negative form of na-adjectives and nouns.
example_japanese: この町は静かじゃありません。

english_explanation: Past tense of です (for nouns and na-adjectives).

pattern_structure: な-adjective + じゃありませんでした
pattern_regex: じゃありませんでした
english_explanation: Negative past tense of na-adjectives and nouns.
example_japanese: 昨日は暇じゃありませんでした。

english_explanation: Like something. The particle が marks what is liked.

pattern_structure: Noun が 分かります
english_explanation: Understand something. The particle が marks what is understood.
There is/exists (for inanimate objects). が marks what exists.
example_japanese: 机の上に本があります。
example_english: There is a book on the desk.

english_explanation: There is/exists (for animate beings). が marks who/what exists.
example_english: There is a person in the room.

pattern_structure: Location に Thing/Person が あります/います
english_explanation: Something exists at a location. に marks the location.
example_japanese: 駅の前に銀行があります。
example_english: There is a bank in front of the station.

pattern_regex: の(上|下|中|前|後ろ|右|左|隣|近く|間)
english_explanation: Location relative to an object: on, under, in, in front, behind, etc.
example_japanese: 机の上に本があります。
example_english: There is a book on the desk.

pattern_structure: Person/Place は Location に Thing が あります/います
english_explanation: Someone/somewhere has something. は marks the possessor, に the location, が the thing possessed.
example_japanese: 私は東京に友達がいます。
example_english: I have a friend in Tokyo.

english_explanation: Approximately, about (used with quantities).

pattern_structure: A が B より Adjective
english_explanation: A is more ~ than B. Comparative structure.
example_japanese: 日本は中国より小さいです。

pattern_structure: A と B と どちらが Adjective
english_explanation: Which is more ~, A or B? Used to compare two things.
example_japanese: コーヒーと紅茶とどちらが好きですか。
example_english: Which do you like better, coffee or tea?

pattern_structure: Group の中で Thing が 一番 Adjective
english_explanation: ~ is the most ~ in/among (superlative).
example_japanese: 日本で富士山が一番高いです。
example_english: Mt. Fuji is the highest in Japan.

pattern_regex: [きしちにみりいぎびぴ]たいです
english_explanation: Want to do something. Expresses personal desire.
example_english: I want to go to Japan.

pattern_structure: Verb stem + たくないです
pattern_regex: [きしちにみりいぎびぴ]たくないです
english_explanation: Don't want to do something. Negative desire.
example_japanese: 今日は働きたくないです。
example_english: I don't want to work today.

pattern_structure: Place に Object を Verb
english_explanation: Do something to an object at a location. に marks destination, を marks object.
example_japanese: ポストに手紙を入れます。
example_english: I put a letter in the mailbox.

pattern_regex: [いきしちにみりんでてねべめれげぜでべぺ]てください
english_explanation: Please do ~. Polite request.
example_japanese: ここに名前を書いてください。

pattern_regex: [いきしちにみりんでてねべめれげぜでべぺ]ています
english_explanation: Present progressive (doing now) or habitual state.

pattern_regex: [いきしちにみりんでてねべめれげぜでべぺ]てから
english_explanation: After doing ~. Indicates sequence of actions.
example_japanese: 朝ごはんを食べてから学校に行きます。
example_english: I go to school after eating breakfast.

pattern_structure: Verb ない-form + でください
english_explanation: Please don't do ~. Negative request.
example_japanese: ここで写真を撮らないでください。

pattern_structure: Verb ない-form stem + なければなりません
english_explanation: Must do ~, have to do ~. Expresses obligation.
example_japanese: 明日早く起きなければなりません。
example_english: I must wake up early tomorrow.

pattern_structure: Verb dictionary form + ことができます
pattern_regex: [るくぐすつぬぶむう]ことができます
english_explanation: Can do ~, be able to do ~. Expresses ability or possibility.
example_japanese: 日本語を話すことができます。
